page.title: 04FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: {PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT { }THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST. CLEMENTS OUTWELL This lovely parish church dates back to the 13th century and other parts were added in the 14th 15th 16th century. It is dedicated to St. Clement who was the third bishop of Rome after Apostles. In the story of St.Clement he was banished into the Crimea where he converted the people to Christianity.The Roman Emperor Trajan ordered St.Clement to be thrown into the sea with an anchor. The statue of the Virgin Mary can be seen standing in front of the wrought iron gates which lead into the Lady Chapel. The Lady Chapel is dedicated to the Virgin Mary. There are some very nice windows mostly 400 years old. The North Aisle is dedicated to St. Nicholas.It was built by John Fincham.
